greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Hamming distance between prime(n) and prime(n+1).
comment: We call "Hamming's twin primes" the pairs of consecutive primes (p,q) with Hamming distance 1. They are (2,3), (5,7), (17,19,), (19,23), (29,31), (41,43), (43,47), (67,71), (97,101),... As in Twin Primes Conjecture, we conjecture that there exist infinitely many Hamming's twin pairs.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Jan 28 2012
ext: Corrected a(24) and a(25) by _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 29 2012
